results.title: Presumed innocent
results.creator_credit: Mirage Enterprises, Sydney Pollack, Mark Rosenberg and Alan Pakula
results.brief_description: This courtroom drama based on the Scott Turow novel of the same name contains murder, sex and intrigue. It stars Harrison Ford as the prosecutor, Rusty Sabich, who is asked to investigate the murder of a colleague. He is reluctant to do so because he has had a previous affair with her. What follows is a twisted tale of suspense and surprise. Supporting cast includes Brian Dennehy, Raul Julia, Bonnie Bedelia, Paul Winfield and Greta Scacchi. Music by John Williams.

results.title: Presumed guilty
results.creator_credit: Vanson Wardle, Michael Mansfield and Yvette Watson
results.brief_description: Presumed guilty compares elements of the French, American and British legal systems to construct an alternative that reaffirms the fundamental right that a person is presumed innocent until proven guilty. Top defence barrister Michael Mansfield QC reveals his agenda for change in the British/Australian system of criminal justice, exposing the brutalities and iniquities of a system once thought to be the most just in the world.

results.title: Preston Sturges: the rise and fall of an American dreamer
results.brief_description: This is a survey of the career of writer-director Preston Sturges tracing the highs and lows of his life illuminated with clips from his films and extracts from interviews with Eddie Bracken, Betty Hutton, Joel McCrea, Paul Schrader, Andrew Sarris and others. Sturges is acknowledged as Hollywood’s first ironist whose satires of American mores skillfully outwitted the Hays code. Clips featured are from “The Great McGinty (1940)”, “Sullivan’s travels (1941), “The Miracle of Morgan’s Creek” (1944), “Hail the conquering hero” (1944), “The Beautiful blond from bashful bend” (1949), plus many more. Narrated by Fritz Weaver.

results.title: Presidential tour
results.brief_description: The President of the U.S.A., Lyndon B. Johnson, and Mrs. Johnson visit Australia in October, 1966. Scenes in Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and Townsville.

results.title: President Soeharto in Australia, February 1972
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Don Murray
results.brief_description: The Indonesian President and his wife are seen arriving at Canberra, and at official functions in Parliament House, the Australian War Memorial, the Melbourne Arts Centre, Mary Mead Children’s Home, Taronga Zoo, the new Indonesian Chancery and other points of interest.

results.title: President Kennedy in Ireland, June 26-29, 1963
results.brief_description: Made by Irish Television, this is an account of President John F. Kennedy’s visit to Ireland in June 1963. It is a straight record of President Kennedy’s return to the land of his forefathers - we see the welcoming ceremony, the motorcade through the streets of Dublin, visits to other principal cities and the informal visit to the family home.

results.title: Preserving the Wasa
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Douglas Gordon and Michael Heckford
results.brief_description: An account of the location and salvaging of the Swedish warship Wasa which sank on its maiden voyage in Stockholm harbour in 1628. Explains the use of the petroleum product Polythlene glycol in the preservation of the wood of the Wasa. It diffuses through the wood cells - forcing out the water and sets hard.

results.title: Preserving our national heritage
results.creator_credit: Cine Service, Balm Paints and Lawrence Reese
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the work of the National Trust and affiliated bodies. Describes how they are preserving, marking and in some cases making available to the public in various states, Australia’s historic buildings, Aboriginal relics, and rare native flora and fauna. Narrated by John Royle.

results.title: Preserving native grasslands
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept of Conservation, Forests and Lands and Conservation Forrest and Lands
results.brief_description: This program examines the problem of our disappearing native grasslands due to the urban sprawl, introduced species and weeds. The department of Conservation, Forests and Land have put out a booklet promoting public awareness of native plants (grasses, flowers and herbs), when and how to identify them, and the various steps involved in preserving them. No other credits available.

results.title: Preserving Egypt's past
results.brief_description: Reveals many of the impressive monuments built by the ancient Egyptians such as the pyramids at Giza and the temples at Karnak, Luxor and Abu Simbal: it also looks at the enormous task faced by archaeologists and Egyptologists in their struggle to preserve the artifacts of Egypt’s past, which are deteriorating at an alarming rate due to population increase, tourism and the Nile’s rising waters. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels. Includes teacher’s guide.
